ai.summary: A strenuous 40 km circuit hike following the Leith Hill Greenway in the UK. The route combines forest and rural paths with sustained elevation, demanding experience and good navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain with long ascents, forest tracks, grassy field paths, and occasional road crossings. Expect uneven ground, mud in wet weather, exposed ridges near the hill, and some rocky sections; navigation is important on rural segments.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard 40 km hike with significant elevation gain. Plan for a full day (8–12 hours) depending on pace. Check weather, as UK conditions can change rapidly; wear sturdy boots and bring appropriate layers and rain gear. Carry a map and compass or GPS, a charged phone as a backup, and inform someone of your route. Stay hydrated and fueled with regular snacks; watch for fatigue and hypothermia in exposed areas. Trails can be muddy and slippery, especially after rain; take care on declines and leaf-covered surfaces. In winter, daylight is limited; start early.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate layers (base layer, fleece or sweater, waterproof shell)
2–3 liters of water and high-energy snacks
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for best conditions; the hike can be attempted in winter by experienced hikers with extra gear and daylight planning.

seo.title: Leith Hill Greenway – 40 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: A challenging 40 km circuit along the Leith Hill Greenway in the UK. Mixed terrain, steep climbs, and scenic uplands make this a test for seasoned hikers.
seo.h1: Leith Hill Greenway – 40 km Hard Hike in the UK
